body_html:
Ok, as explained in issue #1664 it is cudnn bug. But what is the best fix?
Is it better to use cudnn.benchmark = True, or disable cudnn? I am processing large inputs, so I assume that using benchmark flag is not a wise choice. However, my experiments show that with cudnn disabled, networks requires even more GPU memory, than with the benchmark flag..
